parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate. It discusses public opinion regarding the EU and NATO based on a Eurobarometer survey.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is presented as a news report, aiming to reach a wide audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to inform the public about the results of a Eurobarometer survey concerning public trust in the EU and NATO. While this information might indirectly influence voters' opinions, the post does not explicitly advocate for or against any particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a journalistic style, citing a source (Eurobarometer) and providing a link to a more detailed report. It does not appear to be intended to sway voters' choices in the election.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; it presents factual information from a reputable source.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1135929967963034</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by European Media Connections, presents the results of a Eurobarometer survey on public trust in the EU and NATO.  It does not mention any parliamentary candidates or parties, nor does it explicitly encourage voting for or against any specific candidate. The post's style is journalistic, presenting factual information with a link to the source. While the information might indirectly influence voters' perceptions, the post's primary aim is to inform, not to directly influence the parliamentary elections.  The absence of any direct call to action related to the elections, combined with the journalistic presentation, suggests that it does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>European Media Connections</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
